definitions.text:
Let \(S\) be the successor function. \(\mathbb N\) is defined as follows:
  • \(0 \in \mathbb N\)
  • \(\forall n \in \mathbb N . S(n) \in \mathbb N\).
definitions.coq: Inductive nat : Type := | O : nat | S : nat -> nat.

definitions.text:
Let \( ({+}) : \mathbb N \times \mathbb N \to \mathbb N \) be defined as follows:
  • \(0 + m \triangleq m\)
  • \( Sn + m \triangleq S (n + m) \).
definitions.coq:
Fixpoint add (n m : nat) : nat := match n with | O => m | S n' => S (add n' m) end.
Notation "A + B" := (add A B).

theorem.text: Theorem: Addition is commutative, i.e. \[ \forall n, m \in \mathbb N . n + m = m + n \]
theorem.coq: Theorem add_comm : forall n m : nat, add n m = add m n.
